alert.note: Alert for Mississippi (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 3:29AM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Mississippi, southwestern Pemiscot and Dunklin Counties through 400 AM CST... At 329 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cardwell, or 8 miles southwest of Senath, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kennett, Steele, Leachville, Senath, Cardwell, Hornersville, Arbyrd, Deering, Holland, Bragg City, Happy Corners, Lorine, Buckeye, Arkmo, West Kennett, Pawheen, Noland, Garson, Boynton and Rives. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
